Recommended By Curators
"Open world Hong Kong thriller action with a star-studded cast and a great plot. Focus on melee fighting rather than gunplay. Plenty to do."
Read the full review here .
Following

About This Game

Welcome to Hong Kong, a vibrant neon city teeming with life, whose exotic locations and busy streets hide one of the most powerful and dangerous criminal organizations in the world: the Triads.
In this open world game, you play the role of Wei Shen, an undercover cop trying to take down the Triads from the inside out. You'll have to prove yourself worthy as you fight your way up the organization, taking part in brutal criminal activities without blowing your cover.
Torn between your loyalty to the badge and a criminal code of honor, you will risk everything as the lines between truth, loyalty and justice become permanently blurred.

Key Features:

  • A mature and gritty undercover cop drama in which you risk blowing your cover at any time.
  • Explosive action fueled by a seamless mix of deadly martial arts, intense gunfights and brutal takedowns.
  • Epic high-speed thrills: Burn up the streets or tear up the sea in a vast array of exotic cars, superbikes and speedboats.
  • Hong Kong is your playground: Enter illegal races, gamble on cock fights, or kick back with some karaoke. There are countless ways to entertain yourself in Hong Kong's diverse districts.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows Vista Service Pack 2
    • Processor: Core 2 Duo 2.4 GHz or Althon X2 2.7 GHz
    • Memory: 2GB
    • Hard Disk Space: 15GB
    • Video Card: DirectX 10 or 11 compatible Nvidia or AMD ATI card, ATI Radeon 3870 or higher, Nvidia GeForce 8800 GT or higher
    • DirectX®: 10
    • Sound: DirectX compatible sound card
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows 7
    • Processor: Quad-core Intel or AMD CPU
    • Memory: 4GB
    • Hard Disk Space: 15GB
    • Video Card: DirectX 11 Nvidia or AMD ATI card, Nvidia GeForce GTX 560 or ATI Radeon 6950
    • DirectX®: 11
    • Sound: DirectX compatible sound card
READ MORE

大名 Tanegashima
150 products in account
10 reviews
Recommended
58.1 hrs on record
Posted: May 18
Have you ever imagine an open world game such as GTA IV,a game where you obtain the knowledge of Kung-fu and other eastern martial arts, and a game where you find yourself working as a undercover police simultaneously?

If you did so, what are you waiting to buy this game?

A main story line where you work as an under cover police man in the most dangerous gang organizations in the entire world, the Chinese triads...


Sleeping dogs is a game that combines the power of freedom known in the GTA game series, the use of the environment and knowledge in martial arts to unleash powerful attacks and combos known in many fighting games and most importantly, the perfectly mixed in story line of an under cover police man who will get emotionally attached by his work and the people he interacts with.

But, there are few firearms available...

This is true, this isn't america where everything is solved by gunfights or explosions. This is Hong Kong, where strength and skill is valued and measured in epic, pleasant hand-to-hand combats. But even despite that, the use of firearms will depend on your type of game play, and the game will satisfy that lack of weaponry, in amazing breath-taking missions as you progress in the game.

Isn't Hong Kong a bad choice for a game like this?

Definitely not, Hong Kong is currently one of the most wealthiest places in the world; It has everything from a deep underground gang network, a gym to practice or learn new moves after completing each task, a club for you to interact with other people and to complete other side objectives, to random optional objectives and events that will appear in-game.

How are the graphics and the environment design?

To begin with, the game's designers performed extensive research in Hong Kong to create an accurate portrayal of the city. Art designers spent seven days in Hong Kong, where they studied the city's environment, and took more than 20,000 photos as references for the physical environment in the game. And the result was that many reviewers praised the authenticity and charm of the city in the game.

You mentioned the importance of the story line at the beginning, will this mean that after the game story line is completed, there wont be anything else to do?

No, almost all side quests and task will continue to be there, and the game wont change at all in order to preserve it's longevity.

Should I buy this game? and why?

This game is the perfect for anyone who either likes a good detective main story line, an open world sandbox like the GTA game series, and a similar fighting system seem in many fighting genre games.

I would rate this game 81 out of 100, or 4,5 out of 5,0. A masterpiece in mixing both action and adventure gaming genres into one, simply brilliant and well-balanced without looking lame, but truly epic!

Pinta
214 products in account
60 reviews
Recommended
41.7 hrs on record
Posted: July 4
Do you want to buy a game about criminals, but GTA is too expensive? Buy this instead! Sleeping Dogs has a same concept as GTA. Wei Shen, hongkongnese undercover cop, has to work not only for Police, but even for Triad.

My best experience in this game was learning it's basics - For someone, who played GTA or another open-world games with cars, it's hard to get used to drive the cars - steering wheel on the opposite side and opposite traffic lanes... I destroyed many cars before I got used to that.

Pros+
+Good story
+Side jobs and police cases
+Activities(Karaoke, Races, Fighting...)
+Good skill system (Obtaining COP and TRIAD experience)
+Combat system

Cons-
-Too short, I expected longer story
-Too much poitless DLC's (The Year of the Snake and Nightmare at the North Point were good)

8/10

As officer on HK and as a guy on mafia..

I have played on that game once and cant stop .. even finish it thought and now I want to finish it again.
That game reminds me a lot of good games that I liked to play as :GTA, Mafia and Saints row.. well on each game have there cons too on this one we can say the one of the big cons is that your health cant resotre as on each other game and if you want to resotre it you need to buy something to restore it .. well there are more but I think better say the pros on that game instand the cons..
Don't forget to have fun- worth the money :)
